timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

replies.bodyText: If not applied, it uses the default value https://github.com/bipinupd/beam/blob/BEAM-2546/sdks/java/io/influxdb/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/influxdb/InfluxDBIO.java#L133
replies.author: bipinupd

replies.bodyText:
Beam tends to reduce number of knobs exposed to user API.
Is it quite possible that it will be required to change? Can we check in a loop (with a quite large timeout to prevent infinite loop) that everything was flushed?
replies.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.bodyText: nit: numOfElementsToBatch
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.bodyText: What is a reason to have unsafe https client?
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

replies.bodyText: For the cases where InfluxDB is run without proper SSL in internal servers
replies.author: bipinupd

replies.bodyText: I don't think that we have to expose it into user API and implement it inside IO. Can we just allow user to provide a custom client implementation for this case?
replies.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.bodyText: Is it needed to allow user to configure this? Can we set just sufficient default value?
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

replies.bodyText: If not supplied.. It uses the default https://github.com/bipinupd/beam/blob/BEAM-2546/sdks/java/io/influxdb/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/influxdb/InfluxDBIO.java#L134
replies.author: bipinupd

timeline.bodyText: nit: numOfBatchPoints
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.bodyText: If InfluxDB  is not serialisable then it should be transient.
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to handle for every connection.query() an empty result  (if possible) or any exceptions if they can happen?
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

timeline.author: aromanenko-dev
